meanings.definition: To separate or divide into smaller parts
meanings.sent1: The teacher is demerging the big group into smaller teams for the project.
meanings.sent2: I will demerge the puzzle pieces to make it easier to solve.
meanings.sent3: The magician demerged the colorful scarf into multiple pieces, surprising the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter demerged into a symphony of giggles that filled the room.
meanings.sent5: The river demerging into tiny streams created a beautiful natural pattern.

meanings.definition: The act of breaking apart or splitting into separate entities
meanings.sent1: The demerging of the company led to the formation of two new businesses.
meanings.sent2: The demerging of the partnership was a difficult process for both parties.
meanings.sent3: The demerging of the cake into individual slices caused a frenzy at the party.
meanings.sent4: The demerging of the clouds allowed the sun to shine through brightly.
meanings.sent5: The demerging of the traffic into different lanes helped ease the congestion.
